column5: While out last weekend,I noticed clouds of 1/2-1 " shinners, so tied up a couple to try. Sure has heck,they were chomping on them. Could not get enough bigger fish for a feed, but yet another, tie that catches.  I even took out my ultra light that I was gifted a few years back, maybe more from Porkpie. LOL        Oh the sun rise was amazing this morning. Like a painting. Even the moon looked great, better the the photo anyways.    A side note,I need to get a lithium Ion battery for the new finder,as it draws more power then I thought it would from the 7.2 sealed one I have been using.  I am looking at getting one of those milwhacky converter battery attachments for my 5 hr batteries. I know they work well,as another fellow angler uses that for his set up.  Home depot did not have any when I was there yesterday. Guess it,s on line for one, if I can find it .
Great pics , Shinner fly ... well done it looks great ! and it worked !
Nice looking fly brother now find a school of Crappie and I bet you would clean up on them as well.  Art
Nice pics for sure.  One of these days, some fishing store is going to kidnap you to make flies.
Real nice and they work too
At least you got some pretty views
Have a inverter ordered . Found on Amazon.

After watching a couple of the Elite series tournaments, Lake Champlain and the St. Lawrence, some of those flies on a drop shot look better than this? https://outkasttackle.com/feider-fly-2pk/             l
